subject: Re: ant or maven
msgSnippet: ... people say maven is the best choise to use with junit and some say ant is the best for that. But I there is no real metric about the performance. ... if
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, ibrahim demir <ibrahimdemire@...> wrote:

> I have a question about running junit tests with a build tool. Some
people say maven is the best choise to use with junit and some say ant
is the best for that. But I there is no real metric about the performance.
>
> So what is your choice about the build tools. I will be very pleased
if you share your expreince about the test run time,perfomance,plugins
etc..

We have been using maven and since 6 months maven2 in our project
(which uses multiple sub-projects). I like the IDE integration and it
works well with our continuous build system (Luntbuild and currently
as trial TeamCity). I think performance depends more on other factors.
One developer on our team was complaining about the build time with
all tests, which on his machine took more than 10 minutes (and because
of that he didn't run them often enough). On my machine (different OS,
different hardware) I got it down to 2-3 minutes. In order to solve
his long build time, we are trying out TeamCity now, so that a
developer can run the tests on the build server before checking in his
code. The build server can scaled and optimized.

Maven has a learning curve as all tools but until now we are pleased
with it. I does what it should be doing. I recently mavenized 3 old
legacy projects and it was nice to see how it simplified things, which
should save time and money.

Regards,

Harald
